Left ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Presentation2024summer_files/figure-revealjs/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: ### Right ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Presentation2024summer_files/figure-revealjs/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: ### Top ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Presentation2024summer_files/figure-revealjs/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: ### Bottom ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Presentation2024summer_files/figure-revealjs/unnamed-chunk-7-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: ### Diagonal ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Presentation2024summer_files/figure-revealjs/unnamed-chunk-8-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: ::: ## Swiss Bank ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Presentation2024summer_files/figure-revealjs/unnamed-chunk-9-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: ## Outline - R - Prob. and Stat. - Data with R - Stat. with R ![](fig/R.png){.absolute top="10px" right="20px" width="500px"} ::: footer [R tutorial](https://yihsinlu.github.io/2024R.io/docs/Rtutorial.html) ::: # R - [R](https://cran.r-project.org/bin/windows/base/) - [RStudio](https://posit.co/downloads/) - [R online compiler](https://www.mycompiler.io/new/r) ## Get Start ![](fig/Rstudio_start.jpg) # Variables * integer + function (operation) * character * vector * factor * matrix * data frame * list ## Integers ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} x <- 10 y <- 3 ``` ::: * operation ($x+y$ , $x-y$ , $x\times y$ , $\frac{x}{y}$ , and $x^y$) ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} x+y ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 13 ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} x-y ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 7 ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} x*y ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 30 ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} x/y ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 3.333333 ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} x^y ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 1000 ``` ::: ::: ## Function * `function(...){...}` ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} f <- function(x){return(x^2+2)} f(6) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 38 ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} f <- function(x, y){x^2+y^2} f(1, 3) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 10 ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} f <- function(x, y, z){ x^2+2*y+z^3 } f(1, 3, 2) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 15 ``` ::: ::: ## Character ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} chr <- "a" chr ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "a" ``` ::: ::: * string ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} chr <- "characters" chr ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "characters" ``` ::: ::: * sentence ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} chr <- "I am a character." chr ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "I am a character." ``` ::: ::: ## Vector * `c(...)` ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} vec <- c(1, 2, 3, 4, 8, 9) vec ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 1 2 3 4 8 9 ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} vec <- c(0:6) vec ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 0 1 2 3 4 5 6 ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} vec <- c("a", "b", "c") vec ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "a" "b" "c" ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} vec <- c(1, 2, 3, "one", "two", "three") vec ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "1" "2" "3" "one" "two" "three" ``` ::: ::: ## Factor * `factor(vector)` ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} fac <- factor(c("a", "b", "a", "b", "b", "c")) fac ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] a b a b b c Levels: a b c ``` ::: ::: * numeric ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} fac <- factor(c(1, 2, 5, 3, 5, 2, 1)) fac ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 1 2 5 3 5 2 1 Levels: 1 2 3 5 ``` ::: ::: ## Matrix * `matrix(vector, ncol, nrow, byrow)` ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} m1 <- matrix(c(1,0,0, 0,1,1), ncol = 3, nrow = 2, byrow = TRUE) m1 ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [,1] [,2] [,3] [1,] 1 0 0 [2,] 0 1 1 ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} m2 <- matrix(c(1,0,0, 0,1,1, 1,5,2), ncol = 3, nrow = 3, byrow = FALSE) m2 ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [,1] [,2] [,3] [1,] 1 0 1 [2,] 0 1 5 [3,] 0 1 2 ``` ::: ::: ## List ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} List1 <- list(integer1 = x, function1 = f, character1 = chr, vector1 = vec, factor1 = fac, matrix1 = m1) List1$character1 ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "I am a character." ``` ::: ::: * element ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} List1$matrix1 ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [,1] [,2] [,3] [1,] 1 0 0 [2,] 0 1 1 ``` ::: ::: # if else * `if(.){...}` * `if(.){...}else{...}` * `if(.){...}else if(.){...}else{...}` ## how? ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} x <- 1 y <- 2 ``` ::: * `TRUE` / `FALSE` ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} x==y ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] FALSE ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} x!=y ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] TRUE ``` ::: ::: * Is $x=y$ ? ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} if(x==y){"Yes, x is equal to y."}else{"No, x is not equal to y."} ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "No, x is not equal to y." ``` ::: ::: # for loop * `for(. in ..){...}` ## how? ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} sum1 <- 0 for(i in 1:10){ sum1 <- sum1+i } sum1 ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 55 ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} a <- c(1, 2, 3, 4, 7, 2, 4, 1, 1, 4) for(i in 1:10){ a[i] <- a[i]+i } a ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 2 4 6 8 12 8 11 9 10 14 ``` ::: ::: # Packages * `install.packages("dplyr")` * lower right window: `Packages` > `Install` > type `dplyr` ![](fig/InstallPackage.jpg) * `library(dplyr)` to use # Probabilities and Statistics * suppose * observe * prove ## Probabilities $$ 0\leq P(A)\leq 1,\;\forall A $$ * rainy * winning * survival ## Random variable and Distribution * denoted by: $$ X\sim \text{Distribution(.)} $$ * discrete + Bernoulli * continuous + normal + t distribution ## Bernoulli $$ X\sim B(p) $$ * $p$: probability * $x\in\{0,1\}$ * $P(X=1) = p$ * $P(X=0) = 1-p$ ## Normal $$ X\sim N(\mu, \sigma^2) $$ * $\mu$: mean * $\sigma$: standard deviation + $\small P(X=x) = 0$ + $\small P(X\leq x) = \int_{-\infty}^xf(x)dx$ + $\small f(x)=\frac{1}{\sqrt{2\pi}\sigma}\exp(-\frac{(x-\mu)^2}{2\sigma^2})$, $x\in(-\infty,\infty)$ ## t distribution * $X\sim t_n=N(0,1)$ (as $n\rightarrow\infty$) ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Presentation2024summer_files/figure-revealjs/unnamed-chunk-38-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: # Data with R ## Import csv * `read.csv()` ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} df <- read.csv(file = "csv/df.csv", fileEncoding = "Big5") ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} |Name | Height| Weight|Gender | Age| |:------------|------:|------:|:------|---:| |Sam Lu | 177| 82|M | 28| |Lan Huang | 159| 45|F | 21| |Yuji Nishida | 187| 89|M | 24| |Elaine Liao | 164| 53|F | 27| ::: ::: ## Data frame 1 ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(randomNames) set.seed(19970608) New_df.M <- data.frame(Name = randomNames(n = 68, gender = 0, which.names = "first"), Height = rnorm(68, 175, 10),# 68 from N(175,10) Weight = rnorm(68, 70, 10),# 68 from N(70,10) Gender = rep("M", 68), Age = sample(20:40, size = 68, replace = TRUE)) New_df.M ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Name Height Weight Gender Age 1 K'Yeir 169.0641 71.25260 M 24 2 Todd 161.5081 72.95488 M 24 3 Grayson 156.8791 63.20119 M 23 4 Sean 162.5517 71.09409 M 21 5 John Jack 183.2003 80.62568 M 27 6 Arnold 180.6811 57.20870 M 36 7 mean ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} mean(New_df$BMI) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 21.468 ``` ::: ::: * variance ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} var(New_df$BMI) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 23.5321 ``` ::: ::: * correlation ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} cor(New_df$Weight, New_df$BMI) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 0.8651041 ``` ::: ::: ## Summarize ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} summary(New_df) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Name Height Weight Gender Age Length:100 Min. :151.2 Min. :26.22 F:30 Min. :20.00 Class :character 1st Qu.:163.9 1st Qu.:54.87 M:70 1st Qu.:25.00 Mode :character Median :171.3 Median :63.33 Median :30.00 Mean :171.3 Mean :63.04 Mean :30.13 3rd Qu.:178.4 3rd Qu.:72.88 3rd Qu.:35.00 Max. :198.8 Max. :96.98 Max. :40.00 BMI Min. :10.00 1st Qu.:18.32 Median :20.95 Mean :21.47 3rd Qu.:25.62 Max. :33.70 ``` ::: ::: ## Student's t Test $$ H_0: \mu=170 \;\text{ vs } \;H_1: \mu\neq 170 $$ ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} t.test(New_df$Height, mu=170) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` One Sample t-test data: New_df$Height t = 1.3206, df = 99, p-value = 0.1897 alternative hypothesis: true mean is not equal to 170 95 percent confidence interval: 169.3228 173.3724 sample estimates: mean of x 171.3476 ``` ::: ::: ## One-sample t Test $$ H_0: \mu>170\;\text{ vs }\;H_1: \mu\leq 170 $$ ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} t.test(New_df$Height, mu=170, alternative = "greater") #alternative = "less", when H_0:\mu<170 ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` One Sample t-test data: New_df$Height t = 1.3206, df = 99, p-value = 0.09484 alternative hypothesis: true mean is greater than 170 95 percent confidence interval: 169.6533 Inf sample estimates: mean of x 171.3476 ``` ::: ::: ## Two-sample t Test $$ H_0: \mu_1<\mu_2\;\text{ vs }\;H_1: \mu_1\geq\mu_2 $$ ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} t.test(BMI_M, BMI_F, alternative = "less") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Welch Two Sample t-test data: BMI_M and BMI_F t = 3.6305, df = 52.555, p-value = 0.9997 alternative hypothesis: true difference in means is less than 0 95 percent confidence interval: -Inf 6.283122 sample estimates: mean of x mean of y 22.40333 18.10333 ``` ::: ::: # Thanks for your Attention!

include-after-body:
<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
